intro: Phlegmariurus afromontanus, commonly known as the African mountain moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its thalloid structure, which consists of a flat, leaf-like body that lacks true roots, stems, or leaves. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions of Africa. It plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of undisturbed forest ecosystems.
